intro: Sphaerine brevis, commonly known as the short-stemmed sphaerine, is a succulent plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its compact, rosette-forming growth habit. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers during the cooler months, typically in spring. Its fleshy leaves are adapted to store water, making it well-suited for arid environments. Sphaerine brevis is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and low maintenance requirements.
